title: PRD ReDesign: OTC Brand Page

background.description: A brand page is a dedicated page that displays all OTC (Over-The-Counter) products under the same brand. Its goal is to help users quickly find and explore multiple products from a brand they already know and trust.
importance: Improving navigation and discoverability, helping users find trusted product lines easily
Strengthening brand recognition and trust, users are more likely to purchase familiar brands
Increasing average order value (AOV) by cross-selling related products within the same brand

brand_loyal_customers.description: Users who already know and prefer a specific brand (e.g., Avene, Nivea, or Weleda). They trust the brand and want to buy multiple products from it.
brand_loyal_customers.entry_point: They click the brand logo carousel on the OTC homepage, which leads them directly to the brand page

explorers_comparison_shoppers.description: Users browsing OTC products, comparing similar items, and checking available brands before purchasing
explorers_comparison_shoppers.entry_point: They discover the page via a subcategory page or through the brand carousel featured on product or homepage banners

price_sensitive_deal_seekers.description: Users who are motivated by sales and discounts from specific brands, looking for promotional items or bulk offers
price_sensitive_deal_seekers.entry_point: They reach the page via the "Sale" section on the homepage or through CRM promotional campaigns

success_indicators: 5–8% of users who reached OTC category pages also reach the brand page (Adoption KPI)
% conversion from brand page → paid order
AOV (Average Order Value) of users who visited the brand page

requirements: Standard OTC navbar including: Company logo, Search bar, E-prescription button, Cart icon, My Account icon, Hamburger menu
design_sections.notes: Must be sticky at the top of the page (same as OTC homepage)

requirements: A horizontal CRM bar below the navbar for displaying current coupon codes or promotions
design_sections.notes: Use same styling as OTC homepage

requirements: Large brand logo banner at the top
Brand logo must be large and prominent
Display 3 featured products from the brand (hero layout)
The banner should visually represent the brand's color scheme or product style
design_sections.notes: The purpose is to immediately establish brand recognition and encourage exploration

requirements: Reuse the 3 standard OTC homepage USPs: Delivered in 1–2 working days, 24/7 customer service, Free shipping over €30
design_sections.notes: Display as horizontal icons under the banner

requirements: Title: "About [Brand Name]"
Body: 4–8 sentences describing the brand, its heritage, focus, and product qualities
design_sections.notes: Text provided by content team / CRM. Ensure readability and visual balance

requirements: Title: "Sale Products"
Display all products from the same brand currently on sale
Use the same product card design as OTC homepage and category pages
Include discount tag/sticker and both old/new prices
Show up to 2–3 rows (4 products per row)
design_sections.notes: Maintain consistency in sale styling across all OTC pages

requirements: Title: "All Products from [Brand Name]"
Display all available products from that brand
Use same design layout as OTC category pages: 4 products per row, Up to 4 rows (16 products shown initially)
Include a "Load More Products" button at the bottom (same behavior as OTC category)
design_sections.notes: Prioritize image quality and consistency of brand packaging

requirements: Horizontal banner promoting sign-up for newsletters, personalized offers, or brand-specific promotions
design_sections.notes: Same component as OTC homepage CRM section

requirements: Title: "What Our Customers Say"
Carousel of Trusted Shop reviews (same design as Homepage & OTC pages)
design_sections.notes: Build trust through repetition of site-wide credibility elements

requirements: Visual row of all accepted payment method logos (credit card, PayPal, Klarna, etc.)
Standard DoktorABC footer including: Logo, Accordion navigation menus, Payment methods, Company address and certifications, © 2025 DoktorABC.com, Legal disclaimer
design_sections.notes: Must be identical to the existing OTC footer

development_requirements.description: The system must automatically create a new OTC Brand Page whenever a new brand is added in the Back Office (BO). This can use the same infrastructure as the current Manufacturer system. Each brand must include the following fields (editable by the admin in BO): Brand name, Brand description, Two mobile images and two desktop images, Linked products belonging to that brand, Brand by country – admin can select which countries (FR/DE) the brand applies to

Display the standard OTC Navbar component. It includes: Company logo, Search bar (for OTC products only), E-prescription button (navigates to the DoktorABC homepage), Cart icon, My Account, and Hamburger menu. The navbar must be sticky during scroll, identical to the OTC homepage.
Display the OTC CRM coupon strip exactly as it appears on the OTC homepage. It shows the active coupon or promotion for OTC products. On mobile, it appears above the navbar.
Display a main brand image/banner at the top of the page. The image is pulled from the DB based on the selected brand and country.

Display the following standard OTC USPs horizontally under the main image: Delivered in 1–2 working days, 24/7 customer service, Free shipping over €30. The free shipping value (€X) is controlled via the DB. If the value is 0, hide this USP and center the others.

Display a Hero section that contains the brand's main image (from DB) and overlay the brand description text directly on the image. The description text must be localized according to the current country and language.

Title: "Sale Products". Display a carousel of all products from this brand that are currently on sale (from DB). Each product must use the standard OTC product card design (image, name, brand, price, old price crossed in red, discount badge). If there are no sale products, do not show this section at all.

Title: "All Products". Display all products from the brand in a random order. The layout follows the standard OTC category grid: 4 products per row, Up to 4 rows (16 products shown initially), Include a "Load More Products" button at the bottom that loads additional products in the same layout. Each product uses the same OTC product card component (image, name, brand, price, discount badge if applicable).

Display the standard CRM subscription banner that sends leads to HubSpot, including the current page URL and brand name as parameters. The user can close the banner by clicking the X icon, which hides the section and shifts other sections up.
Display the global reviews component (Trusted Shops carousel) identical to the homepage and other OTC pages. It automatically pulls verified customer reviews from the same source.
Display a horizontal row of payment method logos (credit card, PayPal, Klarna, etc.). The design and layout must match the global OTC footer payment section.
Display the standard OTC FAQ accordion with default OTC questions and answers from the DB. The first question is open by default. Texts are localized for each country (FR/DE).
Display the standard DoktorABC footer identical to the existing OTC footer.
